item.title: Jen Hatmaker’s Life Exploded in Middle Age. So She Built a Better One.
item.description: “It’s like I woke up halfway through my life.”

item.title: A Troubled Colleague Asked For My Help. How Much Do I Have to Take On?
item.description: He says he has no one else.

item.title: Ditch the Grocery Store. Join the Barter Economy. Change Your Life.
item.description: A simple exchange of goods can lead to more than you initially bargain for.

item.title: What the Bloom After L.A.’s Wildfires Reveals About Our Ecological Future
item.description: Many of Southern California’s plants and animals evolved with fire as part of their life cycles. Can they weather the worsening fires to come?

item.title: Yotam Ottolenghi Tries Not to Lie. But Then He Met This Salad.
item.description: This crispy fish recipe is inspired by the roast chicken and bread salad at Zuni Café, a dish that prompted a normally honest man to fib for food.

item.title: Has Your Family Argued About Housing and Inheritance?
item.description: We want to hear from you for a New York Times Magazine feature about how much of America’s family wealth is tied up in parents’ homes.

item.title: Should My Husband Praise My Looks More?
item.description: A ruling on how to give and take compliments in a marriage.

item.title: Should I Report My Neighbor’s Animal Abuse?
item.description: I feel trapped: afraid of overstepping with unpredictable neighbors, afraid of doing nothing and regretting it.

item.title: My Brother’s an Unpleasant Drunk. Can I Cut Him Off?
item.description: Life feels too short to keep walking on eggshells around him.

item.title: How Anime Took Over America
item.description: “Demon Slayer” is just the latest confirmation of how Japan’s once-distinctive animation style has become a global visual language.

item.title: A.I. Enters the Museum
item.description: Talented artists are using the technology to do what talented artists always will: ask human questions and express human ideas.

item.title: I Can’t Get Enough of These Easy Cheeseburgers
item.description: This jalapeño-packed recipe yields restaurant-quality results from your home kitchen.

item.title: My Secret for Finding Peace in Traffic
item.description: How a lifelong speedster learned to love the right lane.

item.title: What Does It Take to Get Men to See a Doctor?
item.description: Men in the United States live around five years less than women. One clinic is trying to persuade men that getting checked out could save their life.
